name: Steve McQueen Movies Trivia Game | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: McQueen had a bit part in which of these Paul Newman classics?
questions.explanation:
Somebody Up There Likes Me.

	He had a small part as a young punk.

questions.text:
In "Nevada Smith", McQueen pursues all of the following outlaws 
EXCEPT:
questions.explanation:
Brian Keith.

	Good western revenge story with a fine supporting cast. Keith is a stranger who befriends McQueen.

questions.text: In "The Great Escape", McQueen and James Garner create some crude liquor for the Fourth of July celebration. How do they obtain the liquor?
questions.explanation:
From potatoes.

	Fine movie all the way around.

questions.text: "Bullitt" is certainly one of McQueen's best roles. Where does the big shootout at the end of the movie occur?
In "The Cincinnati Kid", McQueen has a showdown game of poker with whom?
questions.explanation:
Edward G.  Robinson

	Robinson wasn't bluffing - he had the card.

questions.text: "The Magnificent Seven" was an excellent western. Who was NOT one of the Seven?
questions.explanation:
Lee Marvin.

	Marvin didn't deal with the seven, but he dealt with 12 in "The Dirty Dozen".

questions.text: McQueen and Ali MacGraw starred in "The Getaway". Where did they "get away" to?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	They went to Mexico - but they didn't travel in style.

questions.text: Who co-starred with McQueen in "Tom Horn"?
questions.explanation:
Linda Evans.

	Remick was in "Baby, The Rain Must Fall" (which featured the title song by Glenn Yarborough). Weld was in ""Cincinnati Kid" with (Ann Margret). Bergen was in "Sand Pebbles".

questions.text: McQueen starred in "The War Lover". Who wrote the novel on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
John Hersey.

	Hersey, a prolific writer of his day, wrote the novel.

questions.text: Which of these movies does NOT include Steve McQueen in the cast?
questions.explanation:
This Property is Condemned.

	"Hunter" was late in his career. "Enemy" was based on the play by Ibsen. "Soldier" was an offbeat piece with Jackie Gleason. "Property" was with Robert Redford and Natalie Wood. (McQueen starred with Wood in "Love With the Proper Stranger".)
